A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Not sure why all the fuss from so many users. I’m a long time Star Wars fan—for reference\, I thought the prequels were “meh” and that Force Awakens trumps Empire and Jedi both. TFA is still my favorite\, but I’d have to say that I enjoyed this new one nearly as much. There are certainly a couple of “let down” moments that don’t live up to Internet hype about what might be or what should happen\, but the writers sort of have to do that\, I think\, when the internet buzz tries to come up with every possible scenario years in advance of the actual release. Overall\, things end in a good place to pick up from in 2 years\, and (spoilers) the one person that everyone “knows” was going to die actually didn’t\, and the one person everyone knew should not die (Snoke) actually does. It’s not a 5 Star movie\, but every bit a 4\, and nowhere near a zero or 1 or 2. Go with the critics on this one (they can’t get away with being biased assholes and keep their jobs).
